metadata.title: CVE-2023-32233 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel through 6.3.1, a use-after-free in Netfilter nf_tableswhen processing batch requests can be abused to perform arbitrary read andwrite operations on kernel memory. Unprivileged local users can obtain rootprivileges. This occurs because anonymous sets are mishandled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-lowlatency - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1119-aws - 4.4.0-1119.125
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1166-azure - 4.15.0-1166.181~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1119.125').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1166.181~14.04.1').
